Our old friend... loading breakpoints in response to a resource delta. 

Steps:
(1) Create a breakpoint
(2) Debug to the breakpoint (so it is installed)
(3) Close the associated project (while target is running)
(4) The breakpoint is discarded from the breakpoint manager (in an installed 
state)
(5) close workspace
(6) restart workspace
(7) Make sure breakpoints view is open
(8) Re-open the closed project - the breakpoint is created and tries to re-set 
its installed state to uninstalled, which causes the problem (cannot modify a 
resource)

With the existing resource delta/change reporting from Core, there is nothing 
we can do about this. During the PRE_CLOSE change notification for projects, 
the resource tree is locked. There is no post open notification.

Marking as LATER for post 2.0 feature requests.

Jared, do you agree?

I'd have to look at the code in more detail, but I believe we can actually do
better here. 

I believe we add POST_AUTO_BUILD to the type of resource deltas that we listen
to and we can process the project deltas during this callback.

Reopening for more detailed evaluation of this possibility.
*** Bug 24903 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This has already been fixed - the Breakpoint manager listens for 
post_auto_build notifications. Noted that bug 24903 is not actually a 
duplicate, and it has been re-opened.
I believe this is the right fix. Verified.
